STRUCTURE.NAME: graphics_buf_record
STRUCTURE.REGULAR_CMT: Records for the big buffer in seg005, purpose currently unknown. It seems to be used for both 3D engine activity as well as .DEL image processing (although maybe in separate sections?)

MEMBER.REGULAR_CMT: offset

STRUCTURE.NAME: input_capture_record
STRUCTURE.REGULAR_CMT: This is a convenient package of mouse and keyboard input data that is assembled by the game's low-level input interrupt handlers. Its fields seem to have multiple possible purposes.

MEMBER.NAME: modifier_keys_or_mouse_y
MEMBER.REGULAR_CMT: includes the directional (arrow) keys

MEMBER.NAME: mouse_button_states
MEMBER.REGULAR_CMT: bits 0F..0A: unused bits 09..08: RMB and LMB states bits 07..00: interrupt mask

STRUCTURE.NAME: inventory_table
STRUCTURE.REGULAR_CMT: Overall structure of the inventory table (INVENT.TAB), which describes the inventory contents of every ship in the game. It operates as a linked list. This table exists in CONVERSE.DAT (where it describes the initial startup state of the game), in memory at runtime, and in any saved game files.

MEMBER.REGULAR_CMT: Head of a linked list of widget data structs

MEMBER.NAME: action_func_ptr
MEMBER.REGULAR_CMT: Called with one of three arguments depending on the action: 1: Button clicked/activated 2: Button focus acquired 3: Button focus lost

MEMBER.NAME: button_id_currentfocus
MEMBER.REGULAR_CMT: ID of the button in the group that currently has focus. If the button group as a whole does not have focus, then this will be -1 (FF).

MEMBER.NAME: button_id_lastfocus
MEMBER.REGULAR_CMT: ID of the button in the group that had focus when the group last had focus. This will be used to restore focus to the appropriate button when the group gets focus.

MEMBER.NAME: setup_func
MEMBER.REPEATABLE_CMT: first func called as these structs are being traversed

ENUM_ENTRY.NAME: ascii_RIGHT_ARROW
ENUM_ENTRY.REGULAR_CMT: Strictly, there are no ASCII codes for the arrow keys, but 1C/1D/1E/1F are used as equivalents.

ENUM_ENTRY.NAME: button_type_CYCLE
ENUM_ENTRY.REGULAR_CMT: Clicking the button multiple times will cycle a field through different values.

ENUM.NAME: planet_class_type
ENUM.REGULAR_CMT:
The Planet Class Type is used to determine the hostility of the planet's surface to a labor bot, which is indicated in the Send Labor Bot window by the small bracket drawn above the 'ENVIRONMENT' bar.
These values are used on a scale from 0 to 11, so a class type of 5 (Molten) will show a bracket drawn to cover approximately half of the bar.

Base addr for DSS is also the output register for the data FIFO. The status register follows at the next byte address. Finally, the control register follows at the third byte address.
Control register cmds: 04h: Power up DSS 0Ch: Power down (or strobe) DSS

Ten 3-word entries, one for each of the nine common ship activities (raising/lowering shields, etc.), plus one null entry at index 0.
The first eight sets are indices into the THEM.NNV sound file. The last set contains an entry into the COMLINK.NNV file.
When one of these ship actions occurs, each of the valid NNV indices associated with that action will be played in succession.
For example, the second row's indices (0, 1, 3) correspond to these voice recordings in THEM.NNV: 0: "They've" 1: "raised" 3: "their shields!"

Value is 1, 2, or 3, describing the general range into which the current alien temperament falls. Oddly, these values seem to be nonconsecutive, with the lowest range being assigned 1, the middle 3, and the top 2.

Pointer to function that is called to update/redraw screen elements based on new user input. For example, this is called to redraw the selected menu item when the user moves the mouse or presses a shortcut or directional key.
Parameter: 0x0: Do not redraw the area. (Receipt of user input will still cause a redraw.) 0x1: Redraw the area immediately, regardless of whether user input was received. 0x2: Causes some drawing sequences to be skipped entirely?

32h (50) records of 4Ch (76) bytes each.
The first record is reserved for the player's own ship. The other 49 records may be used for other ships.

Points to a buffer of 20 records, 8 bytes each. 00: Weapon status 01: Shield status 02: (unknown, from Ship Table entry +3A) 03: (unused) 04-05: Ship ID 06-07: ptr to Ship Table entry for targeting ship
Set to a value equal to 20 times the value from the CCLASS.TAB record. The table values range from 30 to 180, so this will be 600 to 3600.
Each of the 5 lowest bits indicates that an upgrade is installed for a subsystem: 0x1: Engine 0x2: Shields 0x3: Weapons (i.e. missile loader) 0x4: Scanner 0x5: Jammer
one word per ship class, plus padding (for 32-bit align?)
Function used to draw HUD graphics such as the wireframe grid over ships and planets during scanning, as well as the missile targeting reticle.
Boolean flag, normally cleared. Only set while the player is in combat, because the mouse can be used to pilot the ship and the visible cursor would be distracting.

When this flag is clear, the entire 3D view will not be drawn/updated and will remain black. This includes all ships, the planet, starfield background, and HUD graphics (combat reticle, scanning gridlines, etc.)
Transform buffer for the camera. This needs to be at least 28 bytes (14 words) per record -- is there more than one record?

This buffer contains a header (possibly matching some struct layout) of 14 bytes, plus raw VGA image data for a planet texture. In this buffer, the texture has been expanded to 1.5x its original width.
Header: 00-01: width 02-03: height 04: rotation offset 0A-0D: far ptr to planet scale table buffer

This loop is weird. It increments variables for both the decimal ones place *and* tens place digits each time through, but when it actually builds the filename string, the tens place digit is hardcoded to either '0' or '1' (depending on whether we've passed number 9.) One of the two variables is then used for the ones place.
Since both variables are incremented on each iteration, the second one must be started with a value nine less than its intended first use -- hence the assignment of 27h here.
This whole thing could have been done in a more straightforward fashion by using sprintf() to left-pad with zeroes.

FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: In AX, returns the angle at which the target ship is located, relative to the attacking ship.

FUNCTION.NAME: ships_get_distance_between
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Returns result in DX:AX.

FUNCTION.NAME: distance
FUNCTION.REPEATABLE_CMT: Computes the distance between a ship (given by the flight dynamics struct) and a point in 3D space (given by X,Y coords).

FUNCTION.NAME: render_buffer_get_ptr
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: This is the only place in the code where the pointer to the buffer/struct used to control the 3D camera is set.

FUNCTION.NAME: camera_3d_stop_refresh
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Sets a bit in the supplied 3D camera transform buffer that is related to camera updates/rendering. This is used when the game needs to draw over the current frame, as when drawing the ship-scan gridlines.

FUNCTION.NAME: camera_3d_resume_refresh
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Clears a bit in the supplied 3D camera transform buffer that is related to camera updates/rendering. This is used when the game needs to draw over the current frame, as when drawing the ship-scan gridlines.

FUNCTION.NAME: overlay_drawing_func_set_ptr
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Sets the far ptr to the function used for drawing HUD graphics.

FUNCTION.NAME: overlay_drawing_func_get_ptr
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Returns a far ptr to the drawing function used for HUD graphics.

FUNCTION.NAME: losten_planet_view
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Only called from the Losten gateway functions.

FUNCTION.NAME: planet_load_texture
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Loads the .PLN texture file from disk, and expands each row in the image data by 1.5x by copying the first half of each row and appending it to the end.

FUNCTION.NAME: planet_texture_expansion
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT:
Manipulates the raw VGA image data for planet textures by copying portions of rows into a expanded portion of the buffer.
The provided buffer will be modified such that the first half of each row is appended on the end of the row as well, resulting in an image that is 1.5 times the original width.

FUNCTION.NAME: overlay_file_open_0
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Returns the file handle (in AL) of the open exe.

FUNCTION.NAME: overlay_code_read_from_exe
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: On entry, CX:DX already contains the offset to move the file read pointer.

FUNCTION.NAME: __OvrInitExt
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Returns 1 if XMS memory is available, 0 otherwise.

FUNCTION.NAME: __INITEMS
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: In AX, returns number of unallocated pages.

FUNCTION.NAME: __INITEXT
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: In DX:AX, returns the size of the allocated extended mem.

FUNCTION.NAME: bitmap_allocate_buffer
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT:
Allocates buffer space for an image of the specified width and height, and writes the far pointer to the allocated buffer into the appropriate fields of the provided struct.
Returns 0 in AX upon success.

FUNCTION.NAME: bitmap_load
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Loads raw image data (1 byte per pixel) from a file.

FUNCTION.NAME: bitmap_malloc
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Allocates space for a small (8 byte) info struct that contains pointers to information about bitmap/raster data. Return 0 on success, nonzero on failure.

FUNCTION.NAME: bitmap_free
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Frees memory consumed by the struct describing a graphics data buffer, then frees the memory of the struct itself.

FUNCTION.NAME: draw_box
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Draws a rectangular outline.

FUNCTION.NAME: mouse_action
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: On entry: AX = condition mask causing call CX = horizontal cursor position DX = vertical cursor position DI = horizontal counts SI = vertical counts DS = mouse driver data segment BX = button state: |F-2|1|0| | | `--- left button (1 = pressed) | `---- right button (1 = pressed) `------ unused

FUNCTION.NAME: mouse_copy_input_data
FUNCTION.REPEATABLE_CMT: Returns 1 in AX if the two mouse input records indices are pointing to different records. Returns 0 in AX if the two are pointing to the same record.

FUNCTION.NAME: get_media_id_byte
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Returns the media ID byte for the specified drive in AL (examples: F8h for hard disk, F0h for hi-dens 3.5" floppy)

FUNCTION.NAME: lib_find_filename_in_container_index
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Returns a pointer to the start of the matching .DAT index entry in DX:AX.

FUNCTION.NAME: input_wait_for_keypress
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Returns the character (not the scancode) of the key pressed in AX.

FUNCTION.NAME: vga_get_pixel_count
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Takes a pointer to the first of two 16-bit words that, respectively, contain the image width and height. These are multiplied and the result is returned in AX, representing the total pixel count.

FUNCTION.NAME: image_data_copy
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT:
This routine essentially performs a memcpy of raw VGA data from the source to the destination, using the provided pointers.
The source will be a run of uncompressed VGA data, and the destination will typically be VGA memory (A000:xxxx).

FUNCTION.NAME: vga_draw_rect_filled
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Draws and fills a rectangular region with a single color.

FUNCTION.NAME: vga_draw_rect
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Draws a rectangular outline to the screen, leaving the existing image data in its interior.

FUNCTION.NAME: input_get_keypress
FUNCTION.REPEATABLE_CMT: Returns a keypress in AX. If a mouse button is clicked, the ESC key is returned.

FUNCTION.NAME: font_get_char_width_in_pixels
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Returns the width of the rendered char in AX.

FUNCTION.NAME: debug_print_info
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: On entry to this function, the first item on the stack is a pointer to a string containing the formatted message (printf style). Any following stack items are the parameters that will be inserted into the final formatted string.

FUNCTION.NAME: _strlen_0
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: returns the length of the supplied string in AX

FUNCTION.NAME: buffer_setup
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT:
Allocates buffer space of the requested size and returns a pointer in DX:AX.
Third parameter is a description of the buffer, like "Ship palette" or "Alien palette"

FUNCTION.NAME: debug_print_buffer_info
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Writes buffer (size?) info to the monochrome (text) display when the /aux flag is in effect.

FUNCTION.NAME: mda_draw_16bit_word
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT:
Writes a 16-bit word, in hex, to the position on the monochrome display adapter.
On entry to this function: ES:DI: location in monochrome display adapter memory at which to write a 16-bit value in hex (e.g. B000:008E) AX: value to write

FUNCTION.NAME: j_sound_play_0
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Inputs: flags, ID within NNV, NNV buf ptr

FUNCTION.NAME: j_sound_play_gapless
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: This sound-playing routine appears to be used almost exclusively to play fragments with a zero time gap between them.

FUNCTION.NAME: j_sound_0
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Args: ?, flags, index_in_nnv, bufaddr

FUNCTION.NAME: j_sound_check_info_ptr_valid?
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Returns 1 in AX if sound_info_ptr (or sound_info_ptr_0, depending on the input parameter) is nonzero. Returns 0 if the pointer is null.

FUNCTION.NAME: j_timestamp_compare
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: AX is set to 1 if the second param is earlier then the first.

FUNCTION.NAME: j_ship_downcounter_zero
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Zeroes a downcounter used for an alien ship, but also produces a runtime error message, suggesting that this routine is unused?

FUNCTION.NAME: j_alien_draw_composite_frame
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Reads data from an ANM record (indicated by the index parameter) to decode (and draw to the screen) all of the individual DEL image cels to make up a single frame of alien animation.

FUNCTION.NAME: j_status_popup_check_whether_time_remains
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Returns 1 in AX is there at a nonzero time count remaining on the status popup display. Otherwise, returns 0 in AX.

FUNCTION.NAME: j_alien_del_drawing
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Processes a .DEL alien animation cel and writes the decoded raw image data out to the provided VGA mem location.

FUNCTION.NAME: j_drawing_and_input_processing
FUNCTION.REPEATABLE_CMT: Returns only after user input is received that causes the active window to be closed.

FUNCTION.NAME: j_get_render_params
FUNCTION.REPEATABLE_CMT:
Three out-parameters (pointers): * number_of_frames_to_render_in_batch * accept_input_during_frame_render_flag_ptr * timer_service_enable_flag_ptr
Returns a func ptr in DX:AX.

FUNCTION.NAME: j_render_frames?
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Params: accept_input (bool flag), framecount

FUNCTION.NAME: j_render_setup_with_input_check
FUNCTION.REPEATABLE_CMT: Returns pressed key char in AX. Input params: accept-input flag, framecount

FUNCTION.NAME: j_input_get_keypress_or_keypress_equivalent
FUNCTION.REPEATABLE_CMT: Returns pressed key char in AX.

FUNCTION.NAME: j_input_activity_check
FUNCTION.REPEATABLE_CMT: Called indirectly (via a ptr) as a drawing/rendering func. Returns 1 in AX if a mouse click or keypress was seen.

FUNCTION.NAME: j_rtext_index_file_lookup
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Returns a pointer to a string in DX:AX.

FUNCTION.NAME: j_menu_0
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Inputs: Border color, ?, ?, picklist data ptr, row, column, menu name str

FUNCTION.NAME: j_window_create
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT:
Draws the border/frame of the dialog window, and fills the interior with the background color.
In AX, returns a pointer to the dialog info struct (struct size: 40h bytes).

FUNCTION.NAME: j_window_show
FUNCTION.REPEATABLE_CMT: Returns only after user input causes the window to close. Other graphics rendering, sound cues, etc. will continue to operate.

FUNCTION.NAME: ems_mem_allocate
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT:
Allocates pages of EMS memory to accommodate the size requested through the first parameter.
In AX, returns a pointer into the array of far pointers in seg042.
If the allocation was not possible, -1 is returned.

FUNCTION.NAME: sound_nnv_load_by_name
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT:
Reads the .NNV sound file from the library, decompresses it, and returns a pointer to the buffer in DX:AX.
If the filename is given with a numeric prefix separated by a colon, then the number is used as an indicator of the DAT file in which the NNV will be found.

FUNCTION.NAME: sound_0
FUNCTION.REPEATABLE_CMT: sample params: 1, 4, 0, bufferaddr

FUNCTION.NAME: sound_init_seg043_record
FUNCTION.REPEATABLE_CMT: In DX:AX, returns a far ptr to a record in seg043.

FUNCTION.NAME: sound_file_processing
FUNCTION.REPEATABLE_CMT: In DX:AX, returns far ptr to struct in first section of seg043.

FUNCTION.NAME: fullscreen_img_activity_increment_tick
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Calls a routine that displays a fullscreen image, with its frame-by-frame activity function simply advancing the elapsed display time counter (so that some other action can be taken after the image has been displayed for the requisite amount of time.)

FUNCTION.NAME: intro_color_palette_get_buf_addr
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Returns a pointer to color palette data in DX:AX.

FUNCTION.NAME: intro_play
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Returns true (1) if the intro sequence was allowed to play to completion; false (0) if it was aborted by the user

FUNCTION.NAME: alien_get_name
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Takes the ID of an individual alien as a parameter, and returns a pointer to a string containing that alien's name in DX:AX.

FUNCTION.NAME: alien_get_race
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Takes the ID of an individual alien as a parameter, and returns the ID of that alien's race in AL.

FUNCTION.NAME: alien_temperament_reduce
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Subtract the supplied value from the temperament of the alien specified by the pointer into the Alien State Table. The value is limited to the range 0, 100.

FUNCTION.NAME: alien_temperament_get_range
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Returns the general temperament of the alien at the currently selected Alien State Heap pointer location. Returns 2 if temperament is greater than 70. Returns 3 if temperament is between 31 and 70. Returns 1 if temperament is 30 or lower.

FUNCTION.NAME: object_get_significance_and_value
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: In AX and DX, returns the words from the object table entry for the specified object at offsets 02-03 and at 04-05 (respectively.)

FUNCTION.NAME: place_get_name
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT:
Returns far pointer (in DX:AX) to the string with the name of the place at the provided Place Table index.
Note that this routine may be deliberately called with an unpopulated Place Table index (such as 0) in order to get a pointer to the string "Unknown".

FUNCTION.NAME: travel_time_compute
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT:
In AX, returns the travel time between the two provided location IDs. Time is computed only to the resolution of the star system in which a planet lies. Therefore, the time between two planets within the same star system is always zero.
Depending on the start and end locations, the value returned is typically between 2000h and C000h (when travelling between different star systems.)

FUNCTION.NAME: fact_get_text
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: In DX:AX, returns a pointer to the text for the fact specified by the ID parameter.

FUNCTION.NAME: talk_determine_dialog_based_on_topic
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT:
In AX, returns an index for an IDX file.
This index is treated specially if GTE 800h. In this case, 800h is subtracted before it is used as an IDX index.

FUNCTION.NAME: is_topic_known_to_player
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Topic type: 1: Place 2: Object 3: Alien 4: Fact

FUNCTION.NAME: rtext_parse_into_talk_buffer_1
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Takes a dword pointer to a meta text string, which is processed and added to the "say buffer". A pointer to the say buffer is returned in DX:AX.

FUNCTION.REPEATABLE_CMT: Returns -1 if the talk text is currently paused.

FUNCTION.NAME: inventory_find_object_by_type
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Searches the inventory of the ship specified by the ship_id parameter for any object of the specified type. If at least one object of that type exists in the inventory, the type ID is returned in AL. Otherwise, 0 is returned.

FUNCTION.NAME: inventory_find_object_by_type_and_subtype
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT:
Returns a pointer to the inventory table record containing the first matched object.
When field 08 bit 7 is set, then field 09 is a unique value that identifies a particular unique object. This is used to check for the Fail Safe Device, although it is unclear why that device was not simply checked for by its object ID.

FUNCTION.NAME: inventory_get_num_records_for_ship
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: In AL, returns the number of inventory table records for the specified ship ID. This represents the number of different types of items in the ship's inventory.

FUNCTION.NAME: inventory_get_first_record_for_ship
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Given a pointer to an inventory table record, return a pointer to the the next linked record in DX:AX. If there are no further records for the inventory, return a null ptr.

FUNCTION.NAME: inventory_get_next_linked_record
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Returns the next Inventory Table record in the linked list, starting with the provided record.

FUNCTION.NAME: inventory_get_total_count
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Returns (in DX:AX) the total number of tradeable objects that the player has in his inventory. There are only a handful of non-tradeable objects in the game, and these include story-critical unique items as well as abstract concepts such as The Alliance and The Volm (which shouldn't be in the Player's inventory anyway.)

FUNCTION.NAME: inventory_check
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT:
Checks for the presence of certain inventory objects in the player's ship. Although this routine takes a ship ID as a parameter, it performs no action and returns immediately if the ship is any other than the Player's Ship (FFh).
To keep various global flags current, this is called whenever an object is added to or removed from the Player's inventory.

FUNCTION.NAME: inventory_determine_space_for_trade
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Returns 1 in AX if the Player's ship has sufficient cargo capacity for the trade specified by the args. Returns 0 in AX otherwise.

FUNCTION.NAME: talk_common_phrase_lookup
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Returns a pointer to an rtext string in DX:AX.

FUNCTION.NAME: timestamp_compare
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Compares two gametime structures. If timestamp_b is earlier than timestamp_a, AX is set to 1. Otherwise, AX is set to 0.

FUNCTION.NAME: ship3d_models_and_graphics_load
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Loads all the missile 3D models, shield/explosion sprites, and planet surface texture.

FUNCTION.NAME: ship3d_models_and_graphics_unload
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT:
Called as the Player leaves a planet, and also when starting a conversation with an alien.
Unloads all the missile 3D models, shield/explosion sprites, and planet surface texture.

FUNCTION.NAME: ship_dynamics_update
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Called from the main timer service loop, this routine handles actions performed by the alien ships. This includes heading changes, firing missiles, hailing the Player's ship, and other activities.

FUNCTION.NAME: ship_get_first_in_area
FUNCTION.REPEATABLE_CMT: Returns a ship table ptr in AX

FUNCTION.NAME: ship_get_next_in_area
FUNCTION.REPEATABLE_CMT: Returns either a ship table ptr (or null) in AX

FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Called when the 'aggression downcounter' for a ship reaches zero.

FUNCTION.NAME: ship_leaves_orbit_update_ptrs
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Called only from the ship_leaves_orbit routine

FUNCTION.NAME: alien_ship_action_dispatcher
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: If the call to this routine is skipped, then alien ships will not hail or attack the player, and they will not randomly change their heading while flying in the combat area. (They will still change their heading to remain within the field of play, but only as they approach the edge.)

FUNCTION.NAME: alien_ship_action
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: The return value from this routine (in AX) is used to indicate the action being taken by the alien ship (raising/lowering shields, engaging/disengaging weapon systems, etc.)

FUNCTION.NAME: ship_change_currently_tracked
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Called when the currently tracked ship (either in the combat context, or the scanning/ communication context) is being changed.

FUNCTION.NAME: screen_flash_white
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Creates a white screen "flash" effect by replacing the color at palette index 0 (typically black) with white. This routine also sets a counter that will be decremented each frame until it reaches 0, at which point the normal color will be restored.

FUNCTION.NAME: screen_flash_decrement_frame_count
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Decrements a counter used for a multi-frame transition in which palette index 0 (typically black) is temporarily replaced with white. If this counter has reached zero, palette index 0 is replaced with black to end the effect.

Iterates through the Ship Table entries for all the ships in orbit at the current planet. Check the field at 06-07 in each, and use it as an index into a local array of 20 words. Store the pointer to the table record at the indexed slot in the array.
It looks like this function doesn't have any effect on the game state; it might be a debug routine that was only intended to trap error conditions.

FUNCTION.NAME: ship3d_check_3d_buf_space
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT:
Verifies that there is sufficient remaining buffer space for the polygon data and vertex data (respectively) for the 3D model used by the specified ship class.
Returns 0 if either the polygon or vertex buffers do not have sufficient space for the new model, and returns 1 otherwise. In the latter case, the count of available bytes in each of the polygon and vertex buffers is reduced by the appropriate amount for the ship model.

FUNCTION.NAME: damage_screen_shake
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Adjusts the CRT Controller's horizontal output timing to produce a screen shake/shudder effect.

FUNCTION.NAME: draw_player_damage_effects
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT:
Performs three actions:
- Sets a downcounter that is used to cycle index 0 in the VGA palette, creating a magenta-colored screen flash. - Plays the 'damage' sound effect - Draws a series of randomized "cracks" in the screen (straight white lines)

FUNCTION.NAME: log_update_stardate
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: This routine seems to perform its update function approximately every 23 seconds (on DOSBox 0.74)

FUNCTION.NAME: missile_impact_on_alien_ship
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Called when a missile impacts the player's ship. The single argument is an offset into SHIP.TAB for the entry of the ship that was targeting the player.

FUNCTION.NAME: sprite_animation_downcounter_swap
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Swaps the values between the known locations of downcounters for the combat sprite effects (shield strike and explosion fireball) and the locations provided as offsets.

FUNCTION.NAME: alien_determine_anm_record
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Find a record in the second section of the ANM data that matches the current alien's temperament range. Starting from this point, find the first record in which the first byte has bits 6 and 7 set. Increment the record pointer once more and return this in AX. If no suitable record is found, return 0.

FUNCTION.NAME: alien_find_anm_record_with_bits_01
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT:
Searches the .ANM data currently in the buffer for the first record that meets both of the following criteria:
* Record matches the alien's current temperament (happy/neutral/angry). * Bits 2 and 3 in the record's first byte are set.
The zero-based index (to the entry in the second part of the .ANM data) is returned in AX.

FUNCTION.NAME: alien_draw_composite_frame
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Reads data from an ANM record (indicated by the index parameter) to decode (and draw to the screen) all of the individual DEL image cels to make up a single frame of alien animation.

FUNCTION.NAME: alien_voice_get_nnv_index
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Returns an index into the current alien voice (NNV) file.

FUNCTION.NAME: setup_table_clear
FUNCTION.REPEATABLE_CMT: Writes 0000 to the first word of each of the 50 records in the Setup Table. Also sets the global setup_next_free beyond the end of the Setup Table index range (?), at 32h.

FUNCTION.NAME: nav_is_place_a_match
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT:
Checks the place (indicated by the provided pointer into the Place Table) against the currently selected nav dialog options (inhabited/uninhabited, labor bot site, alien race, etc.)
Returns 1 AX if the place is a match, 0 otherwise.

FUNCTION.NAME: alien_del_drawing
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Processes a .DEL alien animation cel and writes the decoded raw image data out to the provided VGA mem location.

FUNCTION.NAME: inventory_space_check
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: In AX: returns 1 if there is space remaining in the Player's cargo hold, 0 otherwise

FUNCTION.NAME: labor_bot_send_or_retrieve_dialog
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT:
Sets up data that is used to display one of two windows:
(a) Selection of labor bot (and optional botbooster) to send to surface of planet. Displays bar graphs of "ENVIRONMENT" and "EFFICIENCY", which together are intended to indicate how effective the bot will be once on the planet's surface.
(b) Selection of labor bot that is already on the planet, so that it can be retrieved. Displays a bar graph labeled "RATE" and another showing "CARGO".

FUNCTION.NAME: labor_bot_check_presence
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Determines if there is at least one labor robot deployed to the place specified by the argument. Returns 1 in AX if so, otherwise returns 0 in AX.

FUNCTION.NAME: repair_get_subsystem_health_ptr
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Gets a pointer to the memory location containing the current health of the engineering subsystem currently under repair. Returns it in DX:AX. Returns 0000:0000 if no subsystem is currently being repaired.

FUNCTION.NAME: get_first_ship_at_location
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Takes a location ID as a parameter, and loops through the Ship Table until the first ship currently in orbit around the specified planet is found. This ship ID is returned in AX.

FUNCTION.NAME: ship_restock
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Called periodically to refresh certain ship attributes, including restocking missiles for ships other than the Player's.

FUNCTION.NAME: ship_get_total_damage
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Adds up all of the damage taken to the different subsystems on the specified ship and returns it in AX. If the ship is the Player's Ship, this includes the ship_armor value as well.
Only called when five Bellicosians have been killed.

FUNCTION.NAME: restore_buffer_to_ship_table
FUNCTION.REPEATABLE_CMT: Loops 20 (14h) times, reading ship IDs from some buffer and populating fields in the ship table.

FUNCTION.NAME: ship_get_weapon_system_engaged_flag
FUNCTION.REPEATABLE_CMT: Returns the LSB of field at +26 in the provided ship table entry. Does this somehow indicate the status of the ship's weapons system (engaged/disengaged)?

FUNCTION.NAME: missile_ready_to_fire_check
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: If the ship specified by the argument (ptr into ship table) has a zero in both its missile-load and missile-lock downcounters, then the ship has a missile ready to fire and a value of 1 is returned in AX. A value of 0 is returned otherwise.

FUNCTION.NAME: scanner_get_class_parameter
FUNCTION.REPEATABLE_CMT: Returns the value of the first field in the Scanner Class table, which ranges from 03 to FF.

FUNCTION.NAME: ship_get_field3A_bit_0
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Unused function (?) to get bitfield or boolean value from the SHIP.TAB data?

FUNCTION.NAME: scanner_ship_table_entry_operations
FUNCTION.REPEATABLE_CMT: Only takes action if bit 3A.0 in the provided Ship Table entry is set.

FUNCTION.NAME: navmap_get_focus
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Draws a selection border around the navigation starmap. This appears only when focus is on the starmap; it is removed when focus moves to one of the other controls in the window.

FUNCTION.NAME: navmap_lose_focus
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Draws the selection border around the navigation starmap in a different color as the starmap is losing focus.

FUNCTION.NAME: navmap_get_first_star_in_sector
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT:
Searches the Place Table to find the first star whose sector coordinates are within the bounds of the selected sector in the provided navmap data struct.
If a valid star is found, its ID is returned. Otherwise, an invalid ID of 140h is returned.

FUNCTION.NAME: navmap_get_index_of_matching_planet
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Returns the index into the struct array at dseg:D458 whose first word matches the place ID indicated by the supplied navmap widget struct. Returns -1 if no match is found.

FUNCTION.NAME: navmap_change_zoom_level
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT:
Changes the zoom level of the navigation starmap. Returns true if the zoom level change is successful, false otherwise.
This can fail if, for example, the user clicks on a sector with no star systems.

FUNCTION.NAME: shield_strength_update
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT:
Called by periodic/maintenance routine(s) to change the level of the shields on the Player's ship.
This takes effect when the shields are manually raised or lowered, which causes the shield level to drive up or down to the appropriate level. It is also used to cause the shield strength to rebound after absorbing a hit by an enemy projectile.

FUNCTION.NAME: missile_shield_strike
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Called when a missile impacts a ship's shields. Returns (in AX) the remaining missile power after it has been adjusted down.

FUNCTION.NAME: combat_reticle_jostle
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Randomly jostle the targeting reticle in response to an event. This routine is called to coincide with certain combat actions, such as changing the target or firing a missile.

FUNCTION.NAME: combat_set_alien_table_ptrs
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT:
Determine the pilot of the enemy ship being tracked during combat, and set up pointers into various alien tables appropriately.
Returns 1 in AX on success, 0 in AX on failure.

FUNCTION.NAME: missile_loader_get_performance
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT:
Retrieves the two bytes from the Missile Loader Class Table (MSYS.TAB), multiplies them together, and multiplies the result by 64h (100d). Returns the result in AX.
This is used to display the performance of a missile loader in the engineering/upgrade dialog.

FUNCTION.NAME: drawing_and_input_processing
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Returns only after user input is processed that closes the active window.

FUNCTION.NAME: timer_service_routine
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: This routine appears to be called explicitly when certain user activities occur (i.e. selecting a picklist item), but may loop indefinitely when the player is idle. In this latter case, the downcounters are still being serviced, etc.

FUNCTION.NAME: drawing_and_input_processing_loop
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Spins in a loop waiting for user input, and returns only after input is received that results in the active window being closed.

FUNCTION.NAME: render_frames?
FUNCTION.REPEATABLE_CMT: Returns 1 in AX if a keypress or mouse click was registered while rendering; 0 otherwise.

FUNCTION.NAME: render_setup_with_input_check
FUNCTION.REPEATABLE_CMT: Returns pressed key char in AX.

FUNCTION.NAME: input_get_keypress_or_keypress_equivalent
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Returns the pressed key in AX. If a mouse button was clicked instead of a key pressed, then a left-mouse click is translated to Enter and a right-mouse click to ESC.

FUNCTION.NAME: menu_select_item
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Called when mouse or keyboard input is available. This input is used to move the menu item highlight, activate a menu entry, or escape back to the previous menu.

FUNCTION.NAME: window_show
FUNCTION.REPEATABLE_CMT: Returns only after user input causes the window to close. Other graphics rendering, sound cues, etc. will continue to operate.

FUNCTION.NAME: widget_determine_based_on_click
FUNCTION.REPEATABLE_CMT: Returns either 0 or the addr of a widget group/region in AX. Return value is based on screen drawing position comparisons between the window location and the widget group/region locations.

FUNCTION.NAME: widget_button_get_next_in_group
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: This routine is used to find the next button or previous button in a button group by walking the linked list of structs. This is used when arrow keys are being pressed to select the next/previous button, in contrast to the use of TAB to select the next widget group/region in the window.

FUNCTION.NAME: arena_table_get_entry
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Returns an Arena Table ptr in DX:AX.

FUNCTION.NAME: log_editor_unknown_0
FUNCTION.REPEATABLE_CMT: Returns line buffer ptr in DX:AX.

FUNCTION.NAME: widget_texteditor_process_input
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: The input processing routine for the text editor (which is used only in the log window) must handle keypresses for the nonprintable keys (i.e. navigation keys). The game identifies these keypresses by translating the scancode sequence to ASCII codes that approximate the action. For example, the arrow keys get mapped to 1C, 1D, 1E, and 1F (FS, GS, RS, and US respectively.)

FUNCTION.NAME: widget_textarea_draw_outline
FUNCTION.REGULAR_CMT: Draws the border/outline for a multi-line text area. This appears to only be used for the "fact pick" text area widget.

FUNCTION.NAME: fractal_terrain_buffer_read
FUNCTION.REPEATABLE_CMT: Returns the byte at offset (index * 40h) + offset in the fractal terrain buffer.
